comment: Class was overall mediocre at best. However, I believe that it was possibly one of the easiest English classes I could have taken. Grades on papers are based mostly on content and thought. Show up and follow directions and an A is reasonably attainable. As well, his humor is occasionally entertaining.

He's an alright professor. Don't expect to go to class and get an A. You really have to work hard on those essays if you want an A. All the grades in the class are your essays. He wants you to go deeper into every little detail.

Bit of a harsh grader, but if you work hard and put a lot of thought into your essays you will do well. Mainly discussions, can be really boring unless you like talking about what is going on in the world. I felt like it was only english class because we turned in essays. If you like to participate and talk in class you should go for Mr. Fox!

My favorite professor!! I took him for 1101 and 1102. His class can be kind of boring, but only if you don't engage yourself in his discussions. He wants to "expand your awareness" and if you just participate in class you'll find that he will do just that. I definitely recommend Prof Fox for any student that likes to think out of the box.

Not really the teacher to take if you're expecting an A or B. I had an A every year in English prior to this class. So far, I have a C...not really what I was hoping for. Everything to him needs to be "Deeper"

I truly enjoyed his class, he does state that most papers will receive a C but thats because most students don't work. I took the time and always received an A. I also took the time to speak with him after class which helps. He goes off on tangents but for the sake of provoking thought, which is refreshing for a teacher. I would reccomend him.

Challenges you to think on a deeper level. The class is about paying attention and draws many interesting debates. Some of the discussions are out there, but if you truly listen to what he is saying the papers come much easier.

This teacher is AWESOME!If you are interested in scholarly thought then this is the guy for you.If you just want someone to confirm that you're "really smart""like they did in High School" find a more insipid teacher.Professor Fox is for the person who aims to be a well-rounded individual - not a high school suck-up.I got a 95 on my FIRST paper btw

This teacher is really nice and means well, but his classes are irrelevant to English and we talk about things going on in the world. It's an easy class but he is a little strict on grading papers. Overall, this class is ok but I would not suggest you take it.
Avoid at all costs. I should have dropped him last week when I had the chance to do so. I could still make a "B" but it will be very hard to do that because he is ridiculous. AVOID HIM!!!

Very strict, unclear grading system. States in the syllabus "most papers receive the grade of C." He sticks to that. He rambles in class, and it seems more like philosophy than English. Do not take him, especially if you aren't brilliant at English.

I hated this class. All of your papers are about critical thinking. He wants you to disect a piece of work. If you do not agree with his opinion you will make a c on the papers. I hated going to class but he is very serious about the attendance policy.

This class is one where you do well or you don't. He clearly outlines what he wants you to do. If you can quote something, do. Make your thesis and point VERY clear. He likes to talk/ramble. I would recommend this class for people that take criticism and develop themselves to be better writers. Thinking is KEY here. Attendance is necessary.

I'm not quite sure why he wants to teach. He wants everyone to be really deep and into life like he is, but he doesn't seem to realize that the kids taking his class don't care. I think he's trying to save our generation or something. Talks a lot about Bruce Springsteen. Makes you think he's nice the 1st day of class and then spazzes out later.

He inspires us to "take risks in our writing," but his deeper understanding is probably not the same as yours which will probably result in a C. He hates giving out A's or something. The highest grade I got was a 90 and I worked my butt off for that one. Quizzes are relatively easy and the passages we read are short and pretty interesting.

He is a bad teacher. His lectures are boring and pointless. He just guesses at a grade to give you. His favorite phrase is "Dig Deeper". He seems to play favories. I was a strait A student in high school and in this class I am making a C. My highest grade ever recieved on a paper was an 80. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. YOU WILL HATE IT !

Worst everrrrrrr, You will never know what he wants out of you ever.  His grading is absolutely ridiculous and the assignments have nothing to do with english.  Will never take him again ever.  Absolutely horrible.  I was in honors and AP english classes all through high school and now i'm going to come out of freshman comp with a C, not okay.
WORST CLASS EVER!!!! He grades on how deep you think in your papers, not on the content. His grades are random and i've learned nothing in here.

For anybody with a love for english, writing, or literature: do not take this teacher.  His lecture is irrelevant, yet he quizes on it.  It is pretty easy, but he will ask you to "dig deeper" on each paper.  I have learned nothing in this class.  Class is pointless, but mandatory.  I can hardly believe it is a college course.  What a joke.
Teaches things that are completely irrelevant and quizes on them.  He is easy, class is pointless (yet mandatory), and you will learn nothing to carry with you to further english courses.
No Comments

This man is by far the worst teacher I have ever had. No matter how much time and effort you put into a paper you'll most likely recieve an 85. If you're looking for a teacher that grades based on wheither A) likes you and B) agrees with what you have to say, this is the teacher for you. Easy, easy grader.
